cyclone.name: CLAUDETTE
cyclone.current_location: about 310 miles south of Morgan City, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking north across the west-central Gulf of Mexico, forecast to turn slightly northeast and come ashore along the south-central Louisiana coast before moving inland across MS/AL.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: south-central Louisiana coast near Morgan City

weather_observation.watch_coast: No coastal watches posted for the Texas coast west of Intracoastal City, LA
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from Intracoastal City, LA eastward to the Okaloosa/Walton County line, FL (including Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas, and metro New Orleans)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from the TX/LA border eastward through LA, MS, AL to the western FL Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤4%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; occasional gusts possible but gale-force winds unlikely.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge possible near Sabine Pass, generally 1–2 ft; significant inundation not expected at Port Arthur docks.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain Friday night through Saturday could total 3–5 inches with localized higher amounts, producing brief flash-flooding in low-lying port areas.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated brief tornado threat within rain bands; lightning and reduced visibilities may intermittently halt cargo and bunkering operations.
